topic.title: Windows Defender detected a Trojan:Script/CoinHive in a ZeroNet file
topic.body: It was a file called "zerotalk.db", is it something I should be concerned or is it a false positive?

1628479388_14RgUjbLrwrnCSz1tbWorM5dtsY6e.body:
> [jackzeng6666](#comment_12_1AmXimBQuPemuoTM9NFYg9Mn5YY6HomhAm): CoinHive.....That thing is dead, so there is no problem.

Yep, I read about it moments ago

> [smashbuckler](#comment_90_114yCZGnUqTUcasBbAKUS6xmhQyDPC1ZXt): That file is a database file where all the data is stored. What zite address does this data refers to?Highly possible that some zite uses some malicious piece of code, that is used somehow.To give a precise answer on threat, more details needed.

That's the thing, Defender deleted it without a question
